newsitem.title: CANADA: CIBC sets C$100 mln fund for high-tech firms.
newsitem.headline: CIBC sets C$100 mln fund for high-tech firms.

text.p: Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce said on Monday that it set up a C$100 million equity fund for knowledge-based businesses.
The CIBC Innovation Fund would provide venture capital financing to companies involved in software, computers, telecommunications, multimedia, medical and environmental technology, the bank said.
"These businesses often have trouble funding their growth because they may have virtually no track record, or few tangible assets," said Jo-Anne Raynes, head of CIBC's knowledge-based business group.
CIBC said the fund would make available financing as low as C$250,000 to companies that needed only small amounts of capital to get started.
CIBC said advanced technology was a C$50 billion industry in Canada and growing at eight percent annually.
"Over the next 10 to 15 years, knowledge-based business will account for 20 percent of the Canadian economy -- up from today's level of five percent of GDP," the bank said.
The fund is scheduled to start up in early 1997.
